title: Removing a working set immediately causes unintended changes
description: When removing a working set, changes are immediately made without the intended behavior.
OB: When deleting a working set, the package view automatically refilters in the background, which is not expected.
EB: The package view should only refilter when closing the working set selection dialog, not during the process of manipulating the working set. Additionally, pressing cancel should revert all changes made to the working set, including canceling the removal.
SR:
1. Open the working set selection dialog.
2. Delete a working set from the list.
3. Observe that the package view refilters immediately and unintended changes are made.
4. Press cancel and verify that all changes, including the removal, are reverted.
